summary: Completed comprehensive testing of Live Code Mentor Learning Path and Multi-Industry Agents features. Fixed 1 critical ESLint error in AgentsView.jsx. All 20 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI testing passed for all 5 modes and agent interactions.
passed_tests: Backend: /api/agents - Returns all 4 agents (coding, health, travel, business)
Backend: /api/agent/chat - All 4 agent types respond correctly
Backend: /api/agent/health/explain - Returns health explanations with disclaimers
Backend: /api/learning/onboard - Creates personalized learning paths for software, data, business industries
Backend: /api/learning/mentor - Interactive tutoring with conversation history
Backend: /api/learning/complete-topic - Marks topics complete and updates progress
Frontend: Learning Path onboarding wizard (4 steps) works correctly
Frontend: Learning Path roadmap view displays skill tree and weekly plan
Frontend: Agents view displays all 4 agents with proper icons and descriptions
Frontend: Agent chat sends messages and receives AI responses
Frontend: Mode switching between all 5 modes (Learning Path, Agents, IDE, Code, English) works
Frontend: Quick Actions panel displays agent-specific actions
seed_data_creation: Test data created with TEST_ prefix for learning progress tracking
context_for_next_testing_agent: All Learning Path and Multi-Industry Agent features are fully functional. The ESLint error in AgentsView.jsx was fixed by renaming 'useSuggestion' to 'handleSuggestionClick' (React Hook naming convention issue). Backend uses Gemini via emergentintegrations for AI responses. MongoDB collections used: learning_profiles, learning_progress.

bug_fixed.issue: ESLint error: React Hook 'useSuggestion' cannot be called inside a callback
bug_fixed.fix: Renamed function from 'useSuggestion' to 'handleSuggestionClick' to avoid React Hook naming convention conflict
